column4: Hello does anyone know how to use Wine? I am having trouble installing software...
i've used wine to some level, what are you trying to do?
do you know what version of Wine you are using?
using the same version i've never had any issues running .exe files of any sort.   also, the default settings of wine should be pretty much all you need
Why do you think i am getting that error message?
It can't find a volume for extraction, and Ubuntu isn't letting me mount any of my disks all of the sudden.
that's pretty strange, least i've never had that problem.  treating the two problems as seperate, i'd make sure the .exe file is in a directory all users have read and write privlages too
as far as the mounting issue, i've never heard of that, first thing i'd do though is restart.
Should i mount them before i try to install anything?
Also for some odd reason, when i do a warm boot from Ubuntu, my computer freezes at the BIOS/POST. This doesn't happen when i warm boot from XP though.
i wouldn't think so, grub should treat everything equally.
what exactly are you trying to run/install?
I am trying to install it.
i have the vbsetup.exe on my desktop/

i'm not familiar with it, but just an idea, everything i've run so far i've run off of a cd.    wine might for some reason like it more if it is on a cd, just for kicks, i'd try putting the exe file on a cd and installing from that.
